Class AppController

java.lang.Object
core.AppController
public class AppController extends Object
The AppController class manages the application's main logic and coordination between different managers such as graphing, simulation, stock data fetching, prediction, and sentiment analysis. It controls the flow of the application by handling stock data, managing simulations, updating graphs, and facilitating predictions and sentiment processing.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AppController()
    Constructs a new AppController instance and initializes its managers: GraphingManager, SimulationManager, PredictionManager, and SentimentManager.

  • Constructor Details

    • AppController

      public AppController()
      Constructs a new AppController instance and initializes its managers: GraphingManager, SimulationManager, PredictionManager, and SentimentManager. Initially, the stockData is set to null.

  • Method Details

    • selectCompany

      public void selectCompany(String ticker)
      Selects a company by its ticker symbol and fetches its stock data from a CSV file located in "src/CSV/". Updates the current stock data with the fetched data.
      Parameters:
      ticker - The ticker symbol of the company (e.g., "AAPL", "MSFT").

    • getStockData

      public StockData getStockData()
      Returns the current stock data for the selected company.
      Returns:
      The StockData object representing the selected stock's data, or null if no stock is selected.

    • getGraphingManager

      public GraphingManager getGraphingManager()
      Returns the GraphingManager responsible for handling graphing and visualizations.
      Returns:
      The current GraphingManager instance.

    • getPredictionManager

      public PredictionManager getPredictionManager()
      Returns the PredictionManager responsible for managing stock prediction logic.
      Returns:
      The current PredictionManager instance.

    • resetStockData

      public void resetStockData()
      Resets the current stock data to null, effectively clearing the selected company data.

    • getSentimentManager

      public SentimentManager getSentimentManager()
      Returns the SentimentManager responsible for sentiment analysis and processing.
      Returns:
      The current SentimentManager instance.

    • updateStockData

      public void updateStockData(StockData newData)
      Updates the current stock data with new stock data. If the provided data is null, prints an error message. Otherwise, sets the stockData field and prints confirmation messages.
      Parameters:
      newData - The new StockData object to update with.

    • getPlottableStockData

      public StockData getPlottableStockData(String range)
      Retrieves a filtered subset of the stock data based on a specified time range. Supported ranges include:
      • "1W" - Last 1 week (5 trading days)
      • "1M" - Last 1 month (21 trading days)
      • "3M" - Last 3 months (63 trading days)
      • "6M" - Last 6 months (126 trading days)
      • "1Y" - Last 1 year (252 trading days)
      • "5Y" - Last 5 years (1260 trading days)
      • "MAX" - Entire available data
      If the range is unrecognized, returns the full data set.
      Parameters:
      range - The time range identifier (e.g., "1W", "1M", "MAX").
      Returns:
      A new StockData object containing the filtered price points for the specified range, or null if no stock data is loaded.

    • getPlottableStockDataDayTrading

      public StockData getPlottableStockDataDayTrading(String range)
      Retrieves a filtered subset of intraday stock data based on the specified time range for day trading purposes. Supported ranges include:
      • "1H" - Last 60 minutes
      • "1D" - Last trading day (390 minutes)
      • "1W" - Last 5 trading days
      • "1M" - Last 21 trading days
      • "3M" - Last 63 trading days
      • "6M" - Last 126 trading days
      • "MAX" - Entire available data
      If the range is unrecognized, returns the full data set.
      Parameters:
      range - The time range identifier for day trading (e.g., "1H", "1D", "MAX").
      Returns:
      A new StockData object containing filtered intraday price points, or null if no stock data is loaded.
